conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, we need to analyze their motion using the given velocity-time (v-t) graph.
The graph shows the velocity of particles A and B over time.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of each particle.

premise: From t = 0 to t = t_0, particle A accelerates from rest to 2v_0.
conclusion: The displacement during this time is the area of the triangle: Displacement_A = 1/2 * t_0 * 2v_0 = v_0 t_0.

premise: From t = t_0 to t = 2t_0, particle A decelerates from 2v_0 to 0.
conclusion: The displacement during this time is the area of the triangle: Displacement_A = 1/2 * t_0 * 2v_0 = v_0 t_0.

premise: Total displacement of A from t = 0 to t = 2t_0.
conclusion: Total Displacement_A = v_0 t_0 + v_0 t_0 = 2v_0 t_0.

premise: From t = 0 to t = 2t_0, particle B accelerates from rest to v_0.
conclusion: The displacement during this time is the area of the triangle: Displacement_B = 1/2 * 2t_0 * v_0 = v_0 t_0.

premise: From t = 2t_0 to t = 3t_0, particle B moves at a constant velocity v_0.
conclusion: The displacement during this time is: Displacement_B = v_0 * t_0 = v_0 t_0.

premise: Total displacement of B from t = 0 to t = 3t_0.
conclusion: Total Displacement_B = v_0 t_0 + v_0 t_0 = 2v_0 t_0.

premise: Both particles A and B have the same total displacement of 2v_0 t_0 at t = 3t_0.
conclusion: Therefore, particles A and B meet at t = 3t_0.
